title: Double Negation Introduction
description:
Prove that from `P` we can derive `~~P` (double negation introduction).

**Goal:** `forall P : Prop, P -> ~~P`

Remember that `~P` is defined as `P -> False`, so `~~P` is `(P -> False) -> False`.

This direction of double negation is provable in intuitionistic logic.
hints: Unfold the definition of negation: ~P means P -> False
After intros, you'll have P and need to prove False from (P -> False)
If you have H : P -> False and HP : P, then (H HP) gives you False
template:
Theorem double_negation_intro : forall P : Prop, P -> ~~P.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem double_negation_intro : forall P : Prop, P -> ~~P.
Proof.
  intros P HP HnP.
  apply HnP.
  exact HP.
Qed.
